workflow.name: Sync open Zendesk tickets to Google Sheets with Zendesk and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## Description:
Stay on top of your support pipeline with this Ticket Status Digest automation for Zendesk. Built in n8n, this workflow automatically fetches tickets from Zendesk, filters only open ones, enriches them with requester details, and saves them into Google Sheets. üìä

Instead of manually checking Zendesk, you get a real-time digest of pending tickets with full customer details‚Äîperfect for support leads who need a quick snapshot of unresolved cases.
Whether you‚Äôre tracking team workload, prioritizing open issues, or preparing daily status reports, this automation ensures your support data is always structured, centralized, and up to date. üöÄ

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
üîî Trigger ‚Äì Manual Start (or Schedule)
- Begin workflow with a manual trigger (ideal for testing).
- Can be switched to scheduled runs (daily, hourly) for automated digests.
üé´ Fetch All Tickets (Zendesk)
- Pulls all tickets from Zendesk API.
- Captures ticket ID, subject, description, status, priority, tags, and timestamps.
üîç Filter Open Tickets Only
- Includes only tickets where status = open.
- Skips closed, solved, or pending tickets.
üë§ User Information Enrichment
- Looks up requester details (name, email, organization).
- Converts raw IDs into human-readable contact info.
üìä Save to Google Sheets
- Appends/updates ticket rows in ‚ÄúTicket status dummy ‚Üí Sheet1‚Äù.
- Columns: Ticket No. | Description | Status | Owner | Email | Tag.

## Required Integrations:
- Zendesk API (OAuth or API Key)
- Google Sheets (OAuth2 credentials)

## Best For:
üßë‚Äçüíº Support leads monitoring unresolved tickets
üìà Managers building daily ticket status dashboards
ü§ù Teams that need centralized visibility of customer issues
‚è±Ô∏è Anyone tired of manual Zendesk data exports


## Key Benefits:
 ‚úÖ Automated ticket sync to Google Sheets
 ‚úÖ Real-time visibility of open issues
 ‚úÖ Centralized view with enriched requester details
 ‚úÖ Reduces manual tracking and reporting
 ‚úÖ Scalable for daily, weekly, or custom digest runs

workflow.name: Advanced Zendesk Tickets Sync with Analytics & Notifications

parameters.content:
## üéØ Enhanced Workflow Overview

Advanced Zendesk ticket synchronization with:
- Open ticket syncing to Google Sheets
- Priority-based categorization
- SLA tracking and alerts
- Ticket aging analysis
- Automated Slack notifications
- Summary statistics dashboard
- Error handling and logging

**Trigger**: Manual or scheduled (every 15 minutes recommended)

## üé´ Zendesk Data Fetching

Retrieves ALL tickets from Zendesk:
- Ticket ID, subject, description
- Status, priority, type
- Tags and custom fields
- Requester and assignee info
- Creation and update timestamps
- SLA breach information

**Enhanced**: Now captures priority and SLA data

## üë§ User Enrichment

Fetches detailed user information:
- Full name and email
- Organization details
- User role and timezone
- Contact information

**Enhancement**: Also captures user's organization for better categorization

## üîÑ Data Enrichment

Adds calculated fields:
- Ticket age in days
- Priority score (urgent=4, high=3, normal=2, low=1)
- SLA status (breached/at-risk/ok)
- Response time category

**Purpose**: Enable better analytics and prioritization

assignments.name: ticket_age_days
assignments.value: ={{ Math.floor((new Date() - new Date($('Filter Open Tickets Only1').item.json.created_at)) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) }}

assignments.name: priority_score
assignments.value: ={{ $('Filter Open Tickets Only1').item.json.priority === 'urgent' ? 4 : $('Filter Open Tickets Only1').item.json.priority === 'high' ? 3 : $('Filter Open Tickets Only1').item.json.priority === 'normal' ? 2 : 1 }}

assignments.name: sla_status
assignments.value: ={{ Math.floor((new Date() - new Date($('Filter Open Tickets Only1').item.json.created_at)) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) > 7 ? 'BREACHED' : Math.floor((new Date() - new Date($('Filter Open Tickets Only1').item.json.created_at)) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) > 5 ? 'AT_RISK' : 'OK' }}

parameters.content:
## ‚ö†Ô∏è Priority Alert Detection

Identifies tickets needing immediate attention:
- SLA breached tickets (>7 days old)
- Urgent priority tickets
- High priority tickets >3 days old

**Action**: Routes to notification system

## üìä Google Sheets - Main Data

**Enhanced Columns:**
- Ticket No., Description, Status
- Owner, Email, Tag
- Priority, Age (days)
- SLA Status
- Last Updated

**Operation**: Append or Update
- Matches on Ticket No.
- Updates all fields on sync

nodes.name: Save to Google Sheets - Main Data

parameters.content:
## üìà Statistics Aggregation

Calculates workflow metrics:
- Total open tickets processed
- Tickets by priority breakdown
- Average ticket age
- SLA breach count
- At-risk ticket count

**Output**: Single summary record

## üìä Dashboard Sheet Update

**Sheet**: "Dashboard" tab

**Contains**:
- Real-time ticket counts
- Priority distribution
- SLA metrics
- Sync timestamp

**Updates**: Every workflow run
**Purpose**: Quick executive overview

## üîî Slack Notifications

**Triggers on**:
- SLA breached tickets
- At-risk tickets

**Message includes**:
- Ticket number and subject
- Owner and priority
- Age and SLA status
- Direct Zendesk link

**Channel**: #ticket-alerts

nodes.name: Send Slack Alert
nodes.notes: Enable and configure with your Slack credentials

parameters.content:
## ‚è∞ Schedule Trigger (Optional)

**Recommended Setup**:
- Interval: Every 15 minutes
- Active hours: 8 AM - 8 PM
- Days: Monday - Friday

**Alternative**: Hourly or on-demand

*Replace manual trigger with Schedule Trigger node*

## üõ°Ô∏è Error Handling

**Built-in safeguards**:
- Continues on API failures
- Logs errors to separate sheet
- Retries on rate limits
- Validates data before writing

**Error Sheet**: Tracks sync issues
**Recovery**: Manual intervention alerts

## üîç Status Filter

Filters for OPEN status tickets only.

**Logic**: status = "open"

**Other statuses**: pending, solved, closed, new

**Why?** Focus on active tickets needing attention

main.node: Save to Google Sheets - Main Data
Save to Google Sheets - Main Data

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
